p: In genus Bromovirus three types of icosahedral particles are composed of 180 molecules of a 20 kDa CP, and encapsidate different RNA components: RNA1 (Mr c. 1.1 × 10 6), RNA2 (Mr c. 1.0 × 10 6) and RNA3 plus sgRNA4 (Mr c. 0.75 × 10 6 and 0.3 × 10 6). In addition to viral RNAs, BMV virions have been recently reported to package small amounts of host RNAs, with their functions yet to be determined. The members of the genus Cucumovirus, in addition to three genomic RNAs, encapsidate two sub-genomic RNAs (sgRNAs) and a satellite RNA.
